bibl.title: Summons of Joseph D Grafton. Conrad L Zeigler and William Adams
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

keywords.term: Territory of Wisconsin, Grant County, Lancaster

div1.p:
Territory of Wisconsin
District Court for the County of of Grant Sept. term from 1840

Paul Jones- a man of color Plff George W Jones Deft
Trespass on premises.
The United States of america To Joseph D Grafton. Conrad L Zeigler and William Adams. Greetind

Know ye that we in confidence of your prudence and fidelity have appointed you and do by these present give unto you any two of you full power and authority and do hereby require you or any two of you. that at a certain time and place to be designated & appointed by you or any two of you for that purpose, you do cause the witness whose names are mentioned in the caption of the In- terragotories here to annexed. as well as the part of Plff as Defendant on the part of the Deft to come before you or any two of you- and then and there diligently and faithfully examine them when their corporal oaths first taken before you, when said Interrogatories- and that you do take such examination and cause the said Interragatories in the order in which the same are propounded together with the answers of the said witness thereto to be reduced to writing in the order in which they shall be propounded and answered, and when you shall have so taken then you shall cause the said witness to sign their names to the same in their proper places in your presence; and therefore you will annex at the foot thereof a certificate subscribed by yourselves in which you shall state that they are sworn to and signed by the said Defendent and the time and place when and where the same were taken

after which you are to send the said depositions together with this Commission and the Interragatories thereto annexed carfully included and sealed up to the Clerk of the District Court for the County of Grant W ty with the names of the said parties litigant and also a certificate signed by yourselves that the same was sealed up by your endorsed thereon. and this you shall nowise omit.

Witness the Honble Charles Dunn Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of said Ter- ritory and presiding Judge in the District Court of said County of Grant. In testimony whereof I have hereto set my hand & the seal of said Dis- trict Court at Lancaster in said Grant County this 13th day of august Ad 18 Jno L Fletcher Clerk
